articles.headline: House Seeks Contempt Charge Against Meadows in Jan. 6 Inquiry
articles.snippet: The former White House chief of staff previously provided the committee with thousands of pages of documents, including text messages he received on Jan. 6.
articles.abstract: The former White House chief of staff previously provided the committee with thousands of pages of documents, including text messages he received on Jan. 6.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House voted on Tuesday night to recommend holding Mark Meadows, who served as chief of staff to former President Donald J. Trump, in criminal contempt of Congress for refusing to cooperate with its investigation into the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, escalating a legal battle against a potentially crucial witness in a widening inquiry.

articles.headline: Jobless for a Year? That Might Be Less of a Problem Now.
articles.snippet: People who were out of work for a while have typically found it much harder to get a job. The pandemic may have changed how employers view people who have been unemployed for months or years.
articles.abstract: People who were out of work for a while have typically found it much harder to get a job. The pandemic may have changed how employers view people who have been unemployed for months or years.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jamie Baxter used to be skeptical of job applicants who had not worked for long stretches of time, assuming that other employers had passed them over.

articles.headline: With ‘Gunfight,’ an Insider Takes On a Community That Was Once His Own
articles.snippet: Ryan Busse used to be a prominent figure in the firearm industry. A recent book details his disillusionment as he saw gun culture transform — and has drawn disdain from former allies.
articles.abstract: Ryan Busse used to be a prominent figure in the firearm industry. A recent book details his disillusionment as he saw gun culture transform — and has drawn disdain from former allies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Guns have been a constant in Ryan Busse’s life story. His father taught him to shoot as a boy growing up on a ranch in the high plains of Kansas. He and his brother used to wander the land, shooting at rabbits and tin cans with a lever-action rifle that reminded him of the Old West.
articles.byline: By Kristin Hussey and Rick Rojas

articles.headline: Republicans Who Assailed Biden’s Stimulus Bill Are Embracing the Money
articles.snippet: Republican governors who criticized the $1.9 trillion Covid relief bill as wasteful are championing state projects funded by the money.
articles.abstract: Republican governors who criticized the $1.9 trillion Covid relief bill as wasteful are championing state projects funded by the money.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — At her annual budget address this month, Gov. Kristi Noem, Republican of South Dakota, blamed President Biden’s economic policies for rising prices, derided the “giant handout” of federal stimulus funds and suggested that she had considered refusing the money over ideological objections.

articles.headline: Four Resolutions for a Healthier Tech Life in 2022
articles.snippet: The tech world delivered many unpleasant surprises to us in the pandemic. We can learn from them.
articles.abstract: The tech world delivered many unpleasant surprises to us in the pandemic. We can learn from them.
articles.lead_paragraph: The coronavirus pandemic has been packed with plenty of nasty tech surprises.

articles.headline: The Nobel Peace Prize That Paved the Way for War
articles.snippet: This is the story behind how Ethiopia’s prime minister, Abiy Ahmed, won a Nobel Prize for making peace with his country’s longtime enemy — and then used the alliance to plan a war.
articles.abstract: This is the story behind how Ethiopia’s prime minister, Abiy Ahmed, won a Nobel Prize for making peace with his country’s longtime enemy — and then used the alliance to plan a war.
articles.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya — Secret meetings with a dictator. Clandestine troop movements. Months of quiet preparation for a war that was supposed to be swift and bloodless.

articles.headline: Biden’s China Dilemma: How to Enforce Trump’s Trade Deal
articles.snippet: The Biden administration must decide whether to enforce a Trump-era trade deal that has not fulfilled its promise.
articles.abstract: The Biden administration must decide whether to enforce a Trump-era trade deal that has not fulfilled its promise.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When he assumed the White House, President Biden promised to take a different approach to China than his predecessor, saying that the Trump administration’s trade war had hurt American farmers and consumers, and failed to address significant concerns about China’s economic practices.
